P1.title: Social Mirroring Sensitivity
P1.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you respond to subtle changes in communication.
P1.insight: Your responses suggest a heightened awareness of relational dynamics. You adjust your communication style based on perceived emotional shifts in others.
supporting_bullets: You notice when someone's tone or energy changes mid conversation
You interpret pauses or delayed replies as meaningful signals
You adapt quickly to maintain emotional balance in the exchange

P2.title: Protective Withdrawal
P2.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you respond when emotional uncertainty increases.
P2.insight: Your answers show a tendency to create space when something feels unclear. You protect your emotional equilibrium by stepping back until you understand the situation better.
supporting_bullets: You step back when communication feels unpredictable
You prefer to regroup before re engaging
You stabilise yourself through distance before responding

P3.title: Optimistic Projection
P3.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you fill in emotional gaps during communication.
P3.insight: You tend to assume positive intent when signals are ambiguous. This helps you stay open and hopeful even when the information is incomplete.
supporting_bullets: You lean toward best case interpretations
You maintain warmth despite uncertainty
You give others emotional credit before clarity arrives

P4.title: Ambiguity Stress
P4.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you react when communication signals feel inconsistent.
P4.insight: You become more alert when messages do not align. Conflicting cues make you pause and evaluate the emotional landscape before moving forward.
supporting_bullets: You double check meaning when signals clash
You become more analytical under mixed messages
You look for emotional clarity before you commit

P5.title: Emotional Overextension
P5.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you invest emotionally during relational uncertainty.
P5.insight: You tend to give additional emotional effort when something feels off. You may try to fix or stabilise the interaction through extra care or presence.
supporting_bullets: You lean in when others pull back
You try to repair emotional tension before it grows
You often take responsibility for restoring harmony

P6.title: Guarded Interpretation
P6.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you evaluate emotional risk in communication.
P6.insight: You stay cautious until signals feel consistent. You prefer to confirm intent before allowing emotional openness.
supporting_bullets: You look for evidence before trusting emotional cues
You avoid quick assumptions in unclear situations
You protect your emotional boundaries through careful reading

P7.title: Reassurance Seeking
P7.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you stabilise emotional uncertainty.
P7.insight: You look for clear signals to confirm relational safety. You prefer concrete cues to know where you stand.
supporting_bullets: You notice quickly when reassurance is missing
You value direct affirmation to calm uncertainty
You become more expressive when seeking clarity

P8.title: Idealised Connection
P8.core_meaning: Sees the future before the present.
P8.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you envision possibilities during emotional gaps.
P8.insight: You fill unknown spaces with imagined potential. Your mind leans into what the connection could become rather than what is currently confirmed.
supporting_bullets: You build emotional narratives from small cues
You focus on future possibilities
You are inspired by potential rather than limitation

P9.title: Defensive Interpretation
P9.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you protect yourself when signals feel sharp or inconsistent.
P9.insight: You may interpret unclear cues as potential threats. This helps you stay safe but can temporarily narrow emotional openness.
supporting_bullets: You scan for emotional inconsistencies quickly
You react faster to potential negative cues
You pull back to avoid being hurt

P10.title: Adaptive Pleasing
P10.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you regulate connection through responsiveness.
P10.insight: You adjust your behaviour to maintain harmony. You read the emotional needs of others and respond in a way that keeps communication smooth.
supporting_bullets: You intuit what others need in the moment
You shift tone or pace to create comfort
You prioritise relational ease over conflict

P11.title: Emotional Decoding
P11.subtitle: This pattern reflects your ability to translate subtle emotional information.
P11.insight: You naturally decode tone, timing, and micro patterns. You see emotional meaning in details others might overlook.
supporting_bullets: You interpret emotional signals from minimal data
You sense shifts before they are verbalised
You understand emotional subtext quickly

P12.title: Detached Processing
P12.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you manage emotions by stepping into analysis.
P12.insight: When things feel uncertain, you detach slightly and process logically. This helps you find stability before re engaging emotionally.
supporting_bullets: You pause to think before reacting
You separate emotion from decision making
You return to connection once grounded
